Courses.Name: ENVIRSCI 1021F - ENVIRO SCIENCE &SUSTAINABILITY
Description: An overview of the science underlying key environmental issues (e.g. climate change, loss of biodiversity and ecosystem function, air and water pollution, and resource use) and how each issue impacts environmental sustainability from the local to global scale.

Notes: PRIORITY TO STUDENTS REGISTERED AT HURON. JULY 28 PRIORITY CHANGE: ACCESS TO STUDENTS REGISTERED AT AN AFFILIATED UNIVERSITY COLLEGE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Priority will be given to Affiliated University College students in their first year.
TH 3:30-4:30 TUTORIAL ATTENDENCE OPTIONAL.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Priority will be given to students in their first year at Western.
TH 3:30-4:30 TUTORIAL ATTENDENCE OPTIONAL.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Priority will be given to students in their first year at Western.

Courses.Name: ENVIRSCI 3300F - NATURAL SCI OF ENVRNMNTL PROBS
Description: Topics will include: water pollution from toxic chemicals and biological sources; waste disposal and recycling of materials; other current pollution problems. Instruction and practice in library research and essay writing involving aspects of these topics.

Notes: PRIORITY TO STUDENTS IN YRS 3 & 4 ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE MODULES, HSP IN ONE HEALTH (11 SPACES), MAJOR IN ONE HEALTH (4 SPACES), OR MAJOR IN ECOSYSTEM HEALTH.
REQUISITES: Pre-or Corequisite(s): Chemistry 2210A/B.

Courses.Name: ENVIRSCI 3350G - RESEARCH TECHNIQUES IN ENV SCI
Description: A multi-module course where a case study approach will be used to acquaint students with the research tools of environmental science, and the analysis, interpretation and presentation of environmental data.

Notes: PRIORITY TO STUDENTS IN YRS 3 & 4 ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE MODULES, HSP IN ONE HEALTH, OR MAJOR IN ECOSYSTEM HEALTH.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Environmental Science 3300F/G or special permission of the program coordinator.

Courses.Name: ENVIRSCI 4970F - INDEPENDENT STUDY IN ENVIROSCI
Description: A research project course in a particular field under the direction of a faculty member who is a member of the Centre for Environment and Sustainability.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4  MAJOR OR SPECIALIZATIONS IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Enrolment in Year 4 of the Specialization or Major module in Environmental Science. Students must have arranged a project with a supervisor before completing registration.

Courses.Name: ENVIRSCI 4970G - INDEPENDENT STUDY IN ENVIROSCI
Description: A research project course in a particular field under the direction of a faculty member who is a member of the Centre for Environment and Sustainability.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4  MAJOR OR SPECIALIZATIONS IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Enrolment in Year 4 of the Specialization or Major module in Environmental Science. Students must have arranged a project with a supervisor before completing registration.

Courses.Name: ENVIRSCI 4999E - HON RESEARCH PROJECT
Description: A major laboratory or field project that emphasizes experimental design, instrumentation, collection and analysis of data, and communication of experimental results by oral and written presentations.
Antirequisite(s): Environmental Science 4970F/G, the former Environmental Science 4971F/G.
Extra Information: Minimum 15 laboratory hours per week, and during the first term an additional 2 seminar hours per week.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 HONS SPECIALIZATIONS IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL GEOSCIENCE. HELD IN MC 105B

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Fourth year registration in the Honours Specialization in the Environmental Science module. Students must have arranged a project with a supervisor before completing registration. In the late winter, a list of potential projects for the following academic year will be available from the Undergraduate Chair of Environmental Science.
